 We present an analytical model for high-order harmonic generation (HHG) in diatomic molecules, which was based on the concept of molecular orbitals and their associated electronic wavefunctions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The HHG process can be understood as a sequence of three steps: First, electrons are ionized by strong laser fields.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Second, they propagate along the continuum until rescattering with parent ions occurs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Third, these returning electrons emit high harmonics when interacting again in the driving field.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that this picture leads to a simple expression for the emitted harmonic intensity, which depends only on two parameters characterizing the molecule's orbital structure.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This result allows us to explain the observed interference patterns of different harmonics in terms of destructive or constructive interferences between contributions from different molecular orbits.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, we demonstrate how our approach can be used to predict the emission properties of new types of molecules.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 High-order harmonic generation (HHG), i.e., the coherent emission of photons at odd multiples of the fundamental frequency of intense femtosecond laser pulses, have attracted considerable interest over recent years

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It provides access to extreme ultraviolet radiation [3] , which enables novel applications such as attosecond pulse generation [4] , photoelectron spectroscopy [5] , and tomography

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The underlying physical mechanism behind HHG is first explained within the semiclassical three-step model [7, 8] : An electron tunnels out of its atomic core into the continuum upon interaction with the electric field of the laser light.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Afterwards it propagates freely before being driven back towards the nucleus by the same field.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, it recombines with the parent ion emitting a photon whose energy equals the sum of the kinetic energy gained during propagation and the binding energy lost due to tunneling [9] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Since then, several extensions have been developed [10] including the so-called quantum-orbit theory [11] , which takes into account the influence of the nuclear potential on the electron dynamics

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, despite all efforts made so far, there still exist many open questions regarding the microscopic origin of HHG

 We study noise-induced phase transitions of systems with multiplicative white Gaussian, Poissonian or Lévy noise.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that for all these three types of noise there is an optimal noise intensity at which the system undergoes a transition to a state where it performs better than without noise.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The optimal noise intensities are different depending on if we consider additive or multiplicative noise.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For multiplicative noise they depend also on the shape of the power spectral density (PSD) of the noise.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, if the PSD has a peak around zero frequency then the optimal noise intensity decreases as the width of this peak increases.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If the PSD does not have such a peak but decays monotonically towards zero frequencies then the optimal noise intensity increases as the decay rate becomes slower.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, if the PSD decays faster than exponentially then the optimal noise intensity remains constant irrespective of how fast the PSD decays.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The Einstein-Bohr (EB) photon-box [1] , also known as the EPRB [2] or the two-slit experiment

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [3] , has become used to investigate many aspects of quantum mechanics including entanglement [4] , Bell's theorem [5] , and quantum teleportation

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In its original form it consists of a source emitting pairs of photons at random times; one photon passes through a beam splitter while the other travels directly towards a detector.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If we measure whether each photon arrives at either output port of the beam splitter then there will always be exactly one photon arriving at each detector.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This measurement can be performed locally on each side without disturbing the state of the other particle.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However if instead we perform measurements on both particles jointly then they must arrive together at the same detector

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In order for these experiments to exhibit genuine quantum effects, the detectors need to have high efficiency so that the probability of detecting more than one photon per pair is negligible [9] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Previous implementations of EB boxes have relied upon inefficient single-photon counting detectors [10] or inefficient avalanche photo diodes [11] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These devices do not allow us to distinguish between different numbers of detected photons and therefore prevent us from observing truly quantum behaviour [12] .

 Introduction     Dislocations are line defects in crystalline materials where there is a discontinuity in the atomic arrangement along some direction.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They occur naturally in plastic deformation processes such as bending or stretching but also arise spontaneously when certain conditions are satisfied [1] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, it is recently shown that dislocations form at grain boundaries between grains of differing orientations

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [2] , and that they can even appear within single grains [3] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Dislocations are classified according to their Burgers vector b = mu + nv (where u and v are primitive lattice vectors) into edge dislocations if m+n=0, screw dislocations if n=m=1, mixed dislocations otherwise [4] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Edge dislocations correspond to a displacement field perpendicular to the slip plane while screw dislocations give rise to a displacement parallel to the slip plane [5] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Mixed dislocations combine features from both types [6] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The presence of dislocations leads to elastic strain fields around them

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These strains can be calculated using the Peach-Koehler force acting on each individual dislocation [9] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If all dislocations were isolated then the total energy would simply be given by the sum over all contributions from individual dislocations [10] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, for real systems dislocations interact strongly with one another through elastic interactions [11] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As a result, the total energy depends not only on the number density

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 Wireless broadcast has been studied extensively for many years due to its wide range of applications such as data dissemination, file transfer, video streaming, etc.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, most previous works assume that all transmissions occur synchronously or within some fixed schedule.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This assumption does not hold true when there exist multiple transmitters competing for channel resources simultaneously.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Random access (RA) protocols have recently received much attention because they allow users to send packets whenever it is convenient without requiring tight synchronization among them

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Unfortunately, RA introduces additional challenges compared to traditional synchronous transmission models because collisions may happen frequently if no coordination exists between different transmitters [2] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this paper, we study the problem of broadcasting in multi-hop wireless networks with random access.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Specifically, each node maintains one packet which needs to be transmitted to every other node in the network eventually.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Each node chooses independently and uniformly at random a starting time slot to begin transmitting its packet.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If two or more nodes start their transmissions at the same time slot, then these transmissions collide and none of them will reach the intended receivers successfully.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our goal is to design distributed algorithms that achieve both stability and high throughput by minimizing the number of retransmissions required to deliver messages reliably.

 We discuss the gauge invariance properties of effective actions obtained by integrating out heavy degrees of freedom, such as quarks and gluons, within supersymmetric Yang-Mills theories.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that these actions are not generally invariant under local gauge transformations unless certain conditions on their form are satisfied.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results have important consequences in the construction of gauge-invariant observables in supersymmetric gauge theories.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They also provide an explanation why it is possible to construct nontrivial superpotentials even if supersymmetry does not allow any explicit breaking terms at tree level.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally we argue that our findings can been used to resolve some puzzling features observed recently in lattice simulations of N = 1 supersymmetric QCD with four flavors.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Supersymmetric Yang-Mills theories play an important role both within particle physics and string theory.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Their low-energy dynamics are described by an effective action which contains all quantum corrections due to the integration over heavy fields like quarks or gluons.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This effective action has been studied extensively during recent years but many questions remain open concerning its precise structure.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One particular issue concerns the question if this action is gauge invariant.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It was shown already more than twenty years ago

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [1] that if one integrates out only massive fermions then the resulting effective action is indeed gauge invariant.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, when including also massive bosonic degrees of freedom there exist counterexamples where the effective action fails to be gauge invariant [2] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Recently, this problem attracted renewed interest because of its relevance for the understanding of non-perturbative phenomena in supersymmetric gauge theories [3, 4] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 From this work we study the gauge invariance properties systematically using functional methods.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our main result is that the effective action is always gauge invariant up to total derivatives provided two conditions are met.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 First, the effective action will contain no higher-order time-derivatives acting on the gauge field.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Second, the coefficients appearing in front of the various operators in the effective action will satisfy certain relations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, they cannot depend explicitly on the gauge coupling constant g.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If either condition are violated then the effective action will fail to be gauge

 The purpose of this study is to investigate how privacy issues were perceived by users in Europe and what their attitude towards these issues is, when using online learning environments (OLE).

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, some differences are found among countries.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 We present an approach for decision tree learning that uses views over the data in order to improve efficiency and scalability.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The proposed method was based on the idea of using multiple views, each one capturing different aspects or features of the same dataset.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show how this can been achieved by defining a set of views for each node in the decision tree model being learned.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These views are then used as input to a modified version of the standard ID3 algorithm which learns the decision tree structure.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our experimental results demonstrate significant improvements on terms of both accuracy and execution time when compared against existing approaches.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Decision trees have been widely applied in many areas such as classification, regression analysis, clustering, association rule mining, etc., due to their simplicity and effectiveness.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, they suffer from two main drawbacks: (1) high computational cost; and (2) poor scalability.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For particular, the number of possible splits at any given internal node grows exponentially with respect to the size of its parent's training sample.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This makes it difficult to design large decision trees efficiently.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 To address these problems we propose a novel approach called Relational Views-based Decision Tree Learning (RV-DTL).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 RV-DTL builds upon the concept of multi-view learning where each view captures some aspect(s) of the original data.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 More specifically, our approach defines a set of views for every internal node in the decision tree being built.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Each view corresponds to a specific feature subset associated with the corresponding node.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Then, instead of building the entire decision tree from scratch, RV-DTL starts with small sub-trees rooted at leaf nodes and iteratively expands them towards the root until all leaves are reached.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In each expansion step, RV-DTL selects the best split among those available according to the information gain criterion.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, the final decision tree was constructed by merging together.

 1 Introduction Nuclear structure studies play important role for understanding many phenomena observed in nuclear physics experiments [1] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One among these phenomena is the clustering effect [2] , i.e., the tendency to form bound states consisting of several particles or even larger systems like α-particles [3] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In recent years there has been considerable interest in studying the clustering effects in light nuclei [4] - [8] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It was shown [9] that the clustering phenomenon plays significant role in describing the ground state properties of light nuclei such as binding energy, charge radius etc.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Moreover it is found [10] that the clustering effect also influences significantly the reaction dynamics of light nuclei.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, the formation probability of compound nucleus in fusion reactions depends strongly on the number of clusters present in the entrance channel [11] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Therefore, one must take into account the clustering degrees of freedom when investigating the reaction mechanism of light nuclei [12] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For particular, we propose an efficient scheme to perform PLNC at both source nodes simultaneously by using linear codes over finite fields.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Then, we extend our results to multi-way relay channels with more than two users.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we investigate the performance in PLNC under imperfect channel state information (CSI).

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 1. Two-way Relay Channels: We propose a novel approach to perform PLNC on the sources simultaneously based on linear codes over finite fields.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 We have studied the dependence of growth rates for collisionless magnetic instabilities (CMIs) in nonrelativistic electron-ion plasmas with Maxwellian velocity distributions, using linear kinetic theory.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The main idea behind this concept is that we consider not only finite subcomplexes but also their infinite analogues - so-called coverings.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show how covering homology can get used for studying properties of infinite graphs such as amenability or hyperbolicity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 Introduction     In recent years there has been considerable interest in studying the properties of high-temperature superconductors using neutron scattering techniques [1-5].

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, it exhibits a strong dispersion anisotropy along different crystallographic directions [8] and shows significant deviations from the usual linear dependence between the inverse spin wave velocity and momentum [9].

 These results have stimulated theoretical studies [10-12] aimed at understanding how these unconventional spin wave properties are related to the electronic structure of the CuO2 planes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, little attention has so far was paid to the effect of doping on the spin wave dynamics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The Minimal Supersymmetric Standard model (MSSM)

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [1] has been studied extensively over the past few years [2] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It contains many new parameters beyond those of the Standard Model (SM).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These include the gaugino masses M1 , M2 , M3 , the higgsino mass parameter µ, the trilinear scalar couplings A f , and the ratio between vacuum expectation values of the two Higgs doublets tan(beta).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In general, it is difficult to obtain analytical expressions for all the physical quantities in the MSSM [3] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Therefore, one usually resorts towards numerical methods [4] or approximations [5] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Recently, several groups have used approximate techniques [6] -

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [8] to calculate various properties of the MSSM Higgs sector.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The particular, Ref.

 They show that their results agree well with exact calculations [9] .

 We propose that the two branches in the mass distribution of neutron stars are due to different mechanisms for their formation, with one branch being formed by accretion-induced collapse (AIC) of white dwarfs into neutron stars, while another is formed through core-collapse supernovae (CCSNe).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show how this scenario can explain both the existence of massive pulsars as well as the absence of such objects in the observed sample of CCSNe remnants.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The proposed model also explains why there have been no successful attempts so far at detecting gravitational waves emitted during AIC events.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By addition we argue whether our model provides an explanation for the apparent discrepancy between the masses inferred from observations of binary systems containing black holes or neutron stars on one hand, and those inferred from measurements of the radii of isolated neutron stars on the other.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we discuss possible observational tests which could be used to verify our hypothesis.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We study the possibility that gravitational waves can be detected by measuring their effect on gyroscopes in space, as proposed for the GP-B experiment.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We consider two classes for models with torsion and show how they affect the motion of test particles around spinning black holes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In one class we find that there is no effect at all; this includes Einstein-Cartan theory (with or without fermions) and teleparallel gravity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The other class contains some effects but these are too small to be detectable even if the spin of the black hole was known exactly.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, it may still be possible to detect such effects using future experiments like LISA.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we discuss whether any of our results could have been anticipated within general relativity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Stragglers are slow processors whose presence degrades overall system performance.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Identifying these stragglers allows us to take corrective action so that they do not affect other processes running simultaneously.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, if a straggler process takes too much time to complete its task, then it may be possible to offload some work onto another processor to speed up execution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The Standard Model (SM) is an extremely successful theory, but it leaves many questions unanswered about physics at very high energies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, there are no known fundamental principles that can explain why the SM has three generations of quarks and leptons with such different masses or how gravity fits into this picture.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Theories beyond the Standard Model attempt to address these issues by introducing new particles and/or interactions which may be observed in future experiments.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Supersymmetry (SUSY), for example, introduces partners for all SM fields whose spin differs by one half unit.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These partner states have identical gauge quantum numbers as their SM counterparts, so they could mix with them if SUSY is broken at low energy scales.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This mixing can lead to deviations from SM predictions for observables like cross sections and decay rates.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Many extensions to the Standard Model also predict new phenomena associated with extra dimensions of space-time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In instance, theories based on string/M-theory often contain additional spatial dimensions compactified down to tiny sizes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If these extra dimensions exist, then we should see evidence of their effects through virtual exchange of Kaluza-Klein excitations of gravitons and other particles between SM fields localized on our four-dimensional world-volume.

 We report the observation of magnetic fluctuations at low temperatures and high fields in single crystals of YBa2Cu3O6+x (YBCO) with x=0.4, 0.45, and 0.5 using muon spin relaxation measurements.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The data show that these materials were characterized by an unusual temperature dependence of the fluctuation rate which is not consistent with predictions based on Fermi liquid theory or any other conventional model for fermionic quasiparticles.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We argue that this behavior can be understood within a phenomenological description of the electronic excitations as bosonic collective modes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results provide strong evidence of the existence of well-defined fermionic quasiparticles in the normal state of these compounds.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They also suggest that the pseudogap phase may have some features in common with the superfluid state.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 High-temperature cuprate superconductors exhibit many remarkable properties including a rich variety of competing ground states.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, it has be suggested that they undergo a quantum phase transition into a novel ordered state known as the "pseudogap" phase [1] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This phase appears to exist between the underdoped regime where there is no static order but only short-range correlations

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [1] , and the overdoped regime where antiferromagnetism disappears [3] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It is believed that the pseudogap state plays an important role in understanding the mechanism responsible for high-Tc superconductivity [4] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In recent years much attention has focused on the possibility that the pseudogap is associated with preformed pairs of charge carriers [5] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, after considerable experimental effort [6] , direct evidence for such pairing remains elusive

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One possible explanation for this lack of success is because the pseudogap does not arise directly from pair formation [9] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Instead, it can result from the condensation of another type of collective mode

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, if the pseudogap was related to the onset of density wave ordering [11] then one would expect to see signatures of its presence in the form of low-energy magnetic fluctuations [12] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Indeed, several experiments have reported the detection of such fluctuations [13] - [16] .

 We present results of isospin symmetry breaking effects for the ground states and excited states of the mirror nuclei 14Be, 14B, 14C, and 14N using the shell model with realistic interactions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the calculated energy differences between the mirror pairs are consistent with experimental data within uncertainties except for the case of 14N where we predict an excitation energy which is about 1 MeV higher than experiment.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The predicted excitation energies of the first 2+ state in 14Be agree well with those obtained by other theoretical calculations but differ significantly from experiments.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This discrepancy may be due to missing three-body forces or possibly because our calculation does not include any explicit treatment of the continuum.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results show that the effect of Coulomb interaction plays only minor role in determining the properties of these nuclei.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, we have studied the dependence of the calculated results on different single-particle wave functions used as input into the shell-model diagonalization procedure.

 The spin current is the key concept for understanding and manipulating magnetism at nanoscale, which has been widely studied both experimentally and theoretically.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work we study the spin current through an interface between two ferromagnetic layers with different coercive fields by using the Landau-Lifshitz-Gilbert equation combined with the Slonczewski spin-transfer torque term.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that there exists a critical field difference beyond which no steady state solution can be found.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results are consistent with previous experimental observations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This suggests that the spin current may play important roles on the switching process of magnetic multilayers.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Spintronics is one of the most active research areas in condensed matter physics today

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It deals in the manipulation of electron spins instead of charge carriers to achieve novel electronic devices such as spin transistors [4] , spin logic gates [5] , etc.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One of its central concepts is the spin current [6] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A spin current was defined as the flow of angular momentum carried by electrons or holes [7-9].

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Recently it was shown that the spin current plays crucial role in the switching processes of magnetic multilayers [10-12].

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, when a spin-polarized current passes through a magnetic tunnel junction (MTJ), the injected spin current can exert a torque on the local magnetization due to the so-called spin-transfer effect

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If the applied voltage across the MTJ exceeds some threshold value, then the total torque exerted on the local magnetization becomes larger than the damping force so that the magnetization switches direction

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, if the applied voltage is not large enough, the magnetization cannot switch even though the spin current keeps flowing [17] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In order to understand how the spin current affects the switching behavior of magnetic multilayers, many theoretical studies have been performed recently [18-21].

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Most of these works focus on studying the dynamics of the magnetization under external electric field

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Very little attention has been paid to the effects of the spin current itself on the switching behaviors [24] .

 [3] was introduced into wireless communications.

 The Boolean Network (BN) is an important class of models for the analysis and prediction of gene regulatory networks, which are used to describe how genes interact with each other in biological systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this study we use BNs as a tool to predict the order of events during the cell division process of the fission yeast Schizosaccharomyces pombe.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We construct two different BNs using data obtained from microarray experiments performed on synchronized cultures at four time points along the cell cycle.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The first BN was constructed based only on the expression levels of the core set of genes that were found to be essential for cell viability.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The second BN was built including all genes whose expression profiles showed significant changes across the cell cycle.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Using these BNs we predicted the order between events occurring during the cell cycle.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results show that both BNs can accurately reproduce the observed temporal ordering of the cell cycle phases.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, when compared against one another, our results suggest that the inclusion of non-core genes into the BN may lead to more accurate predictions.

 We present an approach to the analysis and design of stochastic gene regulatory networks based on deterministic models that are derived by averaging over all possible realizations of the underlying random process.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show how this method can been used for analyzing the steady-state behavior of such systems, as well as their transient dynamics in response to external stimuli or changes in network parameters.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The proposed framework was illustrated with several examples including synthetic toggle switches and oscillators.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Stochasticity plays an important role in many biological processes ranging from cell cycle regulation to signal transduction

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, it has been shown that noise may have beneficial effects on cellular functions

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [2] , e.g., by enhancing the sensitivity of cells to signals [3] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The study in stochastic gene regulatory networks (GRNs) requires the development of new mathematical tools capable of capturing both the intrinsic fluctuations associated with molecular interactions and extrinsic perturbations due to environmental factors [4] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, most existing methods focus only on the stationary properties of GRNs [9] ; they cannot capture the dynamic evolution of the system when its state variables change continuously [10] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Moreover, some of them require extensive computational resources

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This approach allows us to obtain accurate approximations of the mean value and variance of the output variable(ies), while preserving the main characteristics of the original model [13] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results demonstrate that our technique provides useful insights into the functioning of complex biochemical networks without requiring excessive computational effort.

 We present an analytical solution for the problem for bending thin elastic shells with variable thickness under surface loads, which is applicable to the case where the shell's thickness varies by several orders of magnitude over its radius and where the load distribution is not necessarily axisymmetric.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that in this case it is possible to obtain accurate results using only two parameters instead of three as was previously thought necessary (the third parameter being the ratio between the maximum and minimum values of the shell's thickness).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The new formulation allows us to calculate the deflection from the shell at any point on its surface without having to solve additional equations or perform numerical integration.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This makes our approach much faster than previous methods while retaining high accuracy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our method can be used to model the response of the Earth's crust to tectonic stresses and other processes such as volcanic loading and sedimentary deposition.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It also has applications in geophysics beyond Earth sciences including planetary science, astrophysics and seismology.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In order to study the deformation of the Earth's crust we need to know how the stress field changes across different regions of the planet.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, we are interested in understanding how the stress field evolves during plate boundary interactions like subduction zones and transform faults.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 To do so, we use the theory of elasticity to find solutions to problems involving the interaction between plates and their underlying mantle.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, solving these problems analytically requires simplifying assumptions on the geometry of the system and the mechanical properties of the materials involved.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One important simplification made when studying the mechanics of plate boundaries is to assume that they behave as if they were composed of thin elastic shells.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These shells have been shown to provide good approximations to more realistic models of plate boundaries because they allow for rapid calculations of the stress fields within them.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, Figure 1 shows a comparison between the predictions obtained using a simple spherical shell model and those produced by a finite element model of the San Andreas Fault System.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Figure 1: Comparison between the predicted displacements along the San Andreas fault calculated using a spherical shell model (blue line) and a finite element model (red dots).

 We present exact solutions to the field equations of the Einstein-Gauss-Bonet (EGB) gravity with negative cosmological constant in 5D space-time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that there are three classes of black hole solutions depending on whether the Gauss-Bonnet coupling constant is positive or negative.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition we also obtain another type of solution describing an asymptotically anti-de Sitter wormhole whose throat connects two asymptotic regions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, by using the method developed recently by one of us, we construct a new type of solution representing a time-dependent spacetime horn.

 We study the magnetic field amplification in supernova remnants (SNRs) due to cosmic ray streaming instability, which is driven by anisotropic diffusion of energetic particles across the mean magnetic field lines.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As a result, the instability saturates at some distance behind the shock front where the magnetic energy density becomes comparable to the kinetic energy density of the flow.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In order to estimate the saturation scale we use an analytical model developed recently by Bell et al. (2013) .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It allows us to calculate the spectrum of amplified magnetic fluctuations produced by cosmic ray streaming instability.

 The most prominent feature in our data set is an arc-like structure located at about 0.5 arcsec to the south-east of the central binary star.

 This region shows strong polarized emission up to 10% of the total intensity and has was previously identified as a reflection nebula by Weintraub et al. (1993) .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that this feature can be explained by scattering off optically thin dust grains close to the midplane of the disk.

 By addition we detect two other bright features on either side of the central binary.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These were also associated with high degrees of linear polarization but show no clear evidence for scattered light.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Instead they appear to be caused by absorption against the background stellar flux.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 The concept of zero point energy is introduced in this article, which describes how it can be used to explain some aspects of the big bang theory.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The author also discusses the possibility that dark matter may have become created by such an effect.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally he considers whether or not there are any other physical effects associated with zero point energy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, he suggests that gravitational waves could possibly been generated by such processes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It has since become updated for publication here.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Zero point energy (ZPE) is defined as the minimum amount of energy required to create particles out of nothing.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Although ZPE cannot actually exist because it violates the laws of physics, it does provide useful insight into certain phenomena observed within our universe.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, if we consider the expansion of space-time during the early stages of the universe's existence, then it seems reasonable to assume that the volume of space increased exponentially over time due to the rapid release of ZPE.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If so, then the total mass-energy density would decrease rapidly until all available ZPE had become released.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 At this stage, the universe would consist solely of vacuum fluctuations, i.e., virtual particles and antiparticles existing simultaneously but never interacting with each other.

 Anhedonia is an important symptom of depression and schizophrenia, but its underlying neurobiological mechanisms are still poorly understood.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this study we investigated if exposure to chronic social defeat (CSD) can induce anhedonic-like behavior in male C57BL/6J mice.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We found that CSD-exposed animals exhibited decreased preference for sucrose solution compared with control group.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Moreover, CSD-exposed mice showed increased immobility time in forced swimming test as well as reduced locomotor activity in open field test.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we observed significant decrease in dopamine release in nucleus accumbens shell after acute administration of amphetamine in defeated mice.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results suggest that CSD may be used as animal model of anhedonia.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Anhedonia is one of the most prominent symptoms of major depressive disorder (MDD), which affects about 20% of patients worldwide 1 .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It refers to loss or reduction of pleasure experienced by individuals 2 , resulting in inability to experience joyful events 3 .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition to MDD, anhedonia has been also described in other psychiatric disorders such as schizophrenia 4 , bipolar disorder 5 , obsessive-compulsive disorder 6 , eating disorders 7 , substance abuse 8 , and borderline personality disorder 9 .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, despite being considered a core feature of several mental illnesses 10 , there is no consensus regarding how it should be assessed 11 .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The lack in standardized assessment methods makes it difficult to compare findings across studies 12 .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Therefore, new approaches have emerged aiming at improving the diagnosis and treatment of anhedonia 13 .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The main challenge associated with studying anhedonia lies in the fact that it is not possible to measure directly 14 .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Instead, researchers use indirect measures based on behavioral tests 15 .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, the sucrose consumption test 16 , the forced swim test 17 , and the open field test 18 were commonly employed to assess hedonia 19 .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Although these tests provide valuable information related to anhedonia 20 , they do not allow us to understand the neural circuits involved 21 .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Thus, further investigations using more sophisticated techniques are needed 22 .

 We present an algorithm for generating new solutions to the coupled Einstein-scalar field equations, starting from vacuum solutions and adding scalar fields in such a way that the resulting solution is minimally coupled.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The method can be used to generate exact solutions which are not known explicitly or only implicitly as functions of some parameters (e.g., by solving algebraic equations).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We illustrate our approach on several examples including Schwarzschild-de Sitter black holes, Reissner-Nordström-anti-de Sitter black holes, Kerr-Newman-AdS black holes, and charged dilatonic black holes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular we show how one can obtain explicit expressions for the massless limit of these black hole solutions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 Introduction: Exact solutions play an important role in theoretical physics because they allow us to test various physical ideas against concrete predictions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, finding exact solutions of physically interesting problems often turns out to be very difficult.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, it took more than 100 years after the discovery of general relativity before the first exact black hole solutions was found [1-3].

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Even today there exist many open questions about black holes [4] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One reason why finding exact solutions is so challenging is that most theories of interest do not admit any simple analytic solutions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Another problem arises when trying to find solutions describing systems with multiple interacting components like black holes surrounded by matter or other fields.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here one usually has to solve complicated differential equations numerically which makes it hard to find all possible solutions even if their existence was guaranteed theoretically.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This situation becomes particularly severe if one wants to study phenomena at strong coupling since then numerical methods become less reliable due to large corrections arising from higher orders in perturbation theory.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 To overcome this limitation, NASA's Kepler satellite was launched in 2009 to search for transiting planets around bright stars.

 Furthermore, because of its relatively small field-of-view, Kepler misses out on discoveries made outside of its target fields.

 From this work, we propose a novel cross-layer scheme to improve the performance of distributed wireless ad hoc networks (DWAHNs).

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Furthermore, it employs a modified version on the well-known proportional fairness criterion as well as a utility function that takes into account both the current network conditions and user preferences.

 Horizontal Gene Transfer (HGT) is an important evolutionary force that can increase genetic diversity and accelerate evolution, but it also has negative effects such as disrupting co-adapted gene complexes or introducing deleterious mutations into recipient genomes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Through this study we investigate how HGT affects the mean fitness of unicells evolving under different environmental conditions using computational models.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that HGT increases the mean fitness when cells were exposed to fluctuating environments with high levels of stressful events.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, if there are only mild fluctuations then HGT decreases the mean fitness because it introduces harmful mutations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, for constant environments without any external stresses, HGT will not affect the mean fitness at all.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results suggest that HGT may have played an important role during early stages of life's evolution by increasing its adaptability to changing environments.

 Horizontal Gene Transfer (HGT), which occurs in organisms sharing similar DNA sequences, is one of the most significant evolutionary forces known today [1] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results demonstrate significant improvements in query response times when compared to traditional approaches.

 We propose an approach to causal inference for longitudinal data based on the use of marginal structural models (MSMs) that are restricted by past treatment and covariate histories, which we refer to as "history-restricted" MSMs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our proposed method is illustrated using two examples involving missing data: one where there was no unobserved confounding but some subjects had incomplete outcome information; another example where both incomplete outcome information and unmeasured confounders affected estimation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The first example shows that our proposed method provides estimates similar to those obtained under complete follow-up when all relevant variables have been measured.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In contrast, the second example illustrates situations where standard approaches can lead to biased results due to either incomplete outcome information or unmeasured confounding.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 The information-based asset pricing model is an extension of the traditional CAPM (Capital Assets Pricing Model) that incorporates additional factors into its analysis.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The first factor, market risk premium, represents the excess return investors demand for holding risky assets over and above their returns on low-risk investments such as Treasury bills or bonds.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The second factor, size effect, captures differences in expected returns between small-cap stocks and large-cap stocks.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The third factor, value effect, measures the difference in returns between high book-to-market ratio stocks and low book-to-market ratio stocks; this factor was is shown to be particularly important during periods when interest rates are falling.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This article provides a brief overview of these three factors along with some examples of how they can affect investment decisions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The Capital Assets Pricing Model (CAPM), developed in Sharpe (1964), Lintner (1965), Mossin (1966), and Black (1972), is one of the most widely used models in finance today.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It states that the expected rate of return on any given security should equal the sum of two components - the risk-free rate plus a risk premium associated with the level of systematic risk inherent in each security.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In other words, if you hold a portfolio consisting only of risk-free securities then your expected return will simply be the risk-free rate; however, if you hold a diversified portfolio containing both risky and non-risky securities then your expected rate of return will increase proportionately with the amount of risk you take on.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, suppose we have a hypothetical investor who holds a portfolio consisting of 50% U.S. Treasury bills and 50% Standard & Poor’s 500 Index Funds.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If the current yield on 10-year Treasuries is 5% per year while the S&P 500 Index earns 10% annually,.

We find that these line emissions are well reproduced by a model consisting of two components; one is a photoionized plasma component which emits forbidden lines such as [O III] λλ4959, 5007 and [S II]λλ6716, 6731, while another is a collisionally ionized plasma component which produces prominent Balmer series lines including Hα.

 A mathematical model was developed to study the endogenous and exogenous dynamics associated with pressure fluctuations within an entrained flow gasifier, which are caused by the interaction between fluid mechanics and chemical reactions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The proposed model consists in two parts: one for describing the hydrodynamics inside the gasifier; another for representing the thermochemical processes occurring at different locations along the reactor axis.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In order to investigate how these interactions affect the system stability, we perform linear analysis on both parts separately as well as their combined effect.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It is found that the thermochemical process can be stabilized if the residence time of particles in the reaction zone is sufficiently large.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, this will not always be possible due to practical constraints such as high temperature requirement or limited space available.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, numerical simulations were performed using realistic operating conditions to verify our theoretical results.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These fluctuations often lead to unstable operation of the gasification systems

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [2] , resulting in poor quality syngas production [3] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The main cause of pressure fluctuation lies in the coupling between fluid mechanics and chemical kinetics

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, when the fuel feed rate increases suddenly, more reactants enter into the reaction zone causing higher temperatures there.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This leads to faster chemical reactions and thus larger heat release rates.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As a result, the local pressure rises rapidly.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In the other hand, when the fuel feed decreases quickly, less reactants enter into the combustion chamber leading to lower temperatures and slower chemical reactions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Consequently, the local pressure drops sharply.

 We present an analysis of the evolution of interstellar dust grains, based on their size distribution inferred by infrared observations with ISO (Infrared Space Observatory).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the grain growth was dominated by coagulation at all times since the formation of the Sun.

 We present new results about the evolution and properties of galactic holes, based on an analysis of deep optical images obtained with the Hubble Space Telescope (HST).

 We find that most of these holes were associated to bright star clusters in their centers, which we identify as supermassive black holes (SMBHs) by means of SED fitting techniques.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Galactic holes are ubiquitous features observed within all types of galaxies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They appear as dark regions surrounded by diffuse emission, and they can reach sizes up to several hundred parsecs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Their origin has remained debated since their discovery more than 50 years ago; however, it remains unclear whether they form spontaneously through gravitational instabilities, or if they were created by other processes such as mergers or feedback mechanisms related to active nuclei.

 The geometry in time is the study of how space-time evolves in time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The axiom of choice states that for any collection of non-empty sets there exists at least one set which contains exactly one element from each set.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this article we show that if the universe has an underlying quantum structure then it follows that the geometry of time can be described by using the axiom of choice to select a single point on every trajectory through spacetime.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also discuss some possible implications of our results for neurobiology where the quantum Zeno effect may play a role in explaining certain aspects of brain function such as consciousness.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The geometry of time is the mathematical description of how space-time evolutes over time [1] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It was first introduced into physics by Hermann Minkowski

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [2] who showed that the geometry of space-time could be represented by four numbers (x,y,z,t) called coordinates or co-ordinates.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These are related by the following equation:  x2+y2-z2-t2=(c^2)(1-(v/c))1/2   Where c represents the speed of light and v represents the velocity of the object being observed.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This equation describes the relationship of distance travelled along the x-axis, y-axis, z-axis and t-axis respectively.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, if you were observing someone walking across your living room floor with their back towards you they would have a positive value for the x-axis but no values for the other three axes because they are not moving in those directions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If however you were watching them walk away from you they would have negative values for all three axes except the x-axis since they are still travelling forward in that direction.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As another example consider two objects traveling side-by-side down a roadway.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They will both travel at the same speed so their velocities will be equal.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, if one car travels north while the other travels south they will appear to move faster than each other even though they are traveling at the same speed.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 Social tagging is an emerging technology that allows users to annotate resources with keywords or tags, which is then used by other users in their search and discovery processes.

 From this work we propose a novel approach to exploit social annotation information for automatic resource discovery.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 We study the obfuscation complexity of planar graphs, which are defined as the minimum number of edges that need to be removed in order for an adversary not to be able to distinguish between two isomorphic copies of the graph.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that this problem can been solved by solving a linear program with O(n) variables and constraints (where n denotes the number of vertices), or equivalently by finding the maximum matching on a bipartite graph.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This yields a polynomial time algorithm for computing the obfuscation complexity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In a corollary we obtain a lower bound on the obfuscation complexity for any n-vertex tree T .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we prove that there are infinitely many trees whose obfuscation complexities equal their numbers of leaves.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The obfuscation complexity of a graph G = (V , E ) is defined as the smallest integer k such that removing at most k edges from G makes it indistinguishable from another graph G' = (V ', E').

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In other words, if an attacker has access only to the set of all possible subgraphs induced by some subset S ⊆ V × V then he cannot tell whether he is looking at G or G' unless |S| > k .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work we consider the case where G is a planar graph.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It turns out that in this setting one can solve the obfuscation complexity problem efficiently using combinatorial techniques.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 More precisely, our main result shows how to compute the obfuscation complexity exactly via solving a linear program with polynomially many variables and constraints.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In a consequence of our results we get a new lower bound on the obfuscatability of trees.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Moreover, we provide examples showing that the obfuscation complexity may differ significantly from the size of the largest independent set.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, the source node first transmits data packets using its maximum power level.

 Then, it switches to lower power levels if no packet has been successfully received within a certain time period.

 Keywords: Redundancy estimation, Entropy, Mutual Information, Experiment Planning     1 Introduction     When designing an experiment, we need to know what kind of precision our measuring instrument can give us.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If we want to measure something precisely enough, then we should make sure that there is no correlation between successive measurements made on the same object [1] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, if we have a device which measures the temperature of water at room temperature T = 20 °C , then we should like to obtain values close to 20 ± 0.1°C when repeating the measurement many times [2] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 We present an alternative derivation of Einstein gravity, which does not use the axiom of choice and is based on the concept that topology can be hidden inside general relativity (GR).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This construction allows us to define a metric tensor for each point as well as its inverse.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The resulting theory has exactly the same field equations of standard GR but it contains additional degrees of freedom corresponding to the number of disconnected components of the underlying space.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 The National Institutes of Health (NIH) is the largest funder of biomedical research in the United States, but it also supports non-biomedical research through its extramural program.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The NIH has funded thousands of scientists at hundreds of institutions across the country to conduct basic science research that may have important applications outside of medicine.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This study examines how these researchers are using their NIH funding for non-biomedical projects by analyzing data collected during interviews with them conducted as part of an ongoing longitudinal survey of NIH-funded investigators.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that many of these scientists use their NIH funds primarily or exclusively for non-biomedically related research activities such as teaching, administration, and service work.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, we also find that some scientists who receive NIH support for non-biomedics-related research still spend most of their time conducting biomedically focused research.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, our results show that scientists' perceptions about whether they are spending more time doing biomedically versus non-biomedically focused research do not always match up with actual behavior.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The temporal behavior of this event was complex; it consisted of multiple pulses that appeared superimposed on top of each other during both the prompt emission phase as well as the early part of its afterglow.

 This flattening can be due either to continued activity of the central engine or to refreshed shocks.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that the VDOS can be decomposed into three main contributions: one at low frequencies corresponding to acoustic phonons; another contribution centered around the Debye frequency which are associated with optical phonons; and finally a third contribution located at high frequencies whose origin lies on the presence of unstable modes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The latter are responsible of the appearance of the so-called boson peak in the VDOS.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition we find that these unstable modes have a strong tendency to form clusters or groups of correlated particles.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This localization effect leads us to propose a simple model based on the existence of two different types of sites within the materials: stable ones characterized by their ability to support vibrations over large energy ranges, while unstable sites only allow small-amplitude oscillations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The method allows to take into account all relevant experimental uncertainties including those related to background subtraction as well as systematic effects such as energy calibration or detector efficiency variations over time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In order to test possible explanations of the observed excess, one needs to know how many positrons were produced per annihilation event.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, if dark matter particles annihilate predominantly into leptons, then the total number of electrons plus positrons produced per annihilation should equal four times the number of photons produced [5] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If instead dark matter annihilates mostly into quarks, then the ratio between electron-positron pairs and gamma rays will depend on the mass spectrum of the final state hadrons [6] .

 We present the first fully general-relativistic magnetohydrodynamic (MHD) simulations for the gravitational collapse of rotating, magnetic white dwarfs and neutron stars with initial masses up to 100 solar masses.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that for all models considered here, the central density increases by at least eight orders of magnitude during the collapse process.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The final state is always a Kerr black hole surrounded with an accretion disk.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For most cases we consider, the mass of the black hole exceeds the Chandrasekhar limit by more than 10%.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This suggests that there may be no maximum stable mass for nonrotating stellar cores.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we discuss how these findings can get used to explain some observed phenomena such as gamma-ray bursts and superluminous supernovae.

 We present the results from our study on bimodality in galaxies and active galactic nuclei (AGN).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that there is no significant difference between the fraction of AGNs hosted by red or blue galaxies, but we do see an excess of AGNs with respect to normal galaxies at intermediate colors.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 Here we propose that graphene can become used as such material by exploiting its unique electronic structure.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This results in a switching behavior similar to conventional transistors.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we discuss possible experimental realizations of the proposed device.

 To improve the efficiency of WMNs, it has been shown recently that joint design of the network layer and the physical layer is necessary

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [3] , where the network layer determines how to route data packets while the physical layer decides what transmit power levels should are used as well as what beamforming vectors should be adopted [4] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, most previous works focus either on the network layer or the physical layer separately

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [5] , ignoring the fact that they interact closely with one another [6] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present new theoretical evolutionary tracks for the mass range 1.8 to 2.5 M⊙, which are based on an improved treatment of convection in stellar interiors.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We use these tracks as input to our seismic modelling code CESAM2k to compute synthetic seismograms for two different sets of observed frequencies (from COROT) corresponding to two possible values of the inclination angle i = 90° or 60° .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The comparison between observations and theory shows that we can exclude one set of frequencies at high confidence level but not the other.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This is due to the fact which the frequency differences between ℓ=0 and ℓ=2 modes depend strongly on the inclination angle.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, we find that the best fit model has a radius R=1.95R⊙ , which agrees well with the value inferred by asteroseismology using only ℓ=0 modes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we show how this result could be used to determine the age of the star.

 Keywords: Seismic modelling

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We report the discovery of a new satellite galaxy, dubbed "A pair of bootes" (ApoBootes), orbiting around our Galaxy at a distance of about 300 kpc in projection and with an estimated mass of 1.5 x 10^10 M_sun .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 ApoBootes are located on the opposite side of the Galactic center to the Magellanic Clouds and has a very low surface brightness.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We have used deep near-infrared images taken by the VISTA telescope as part of the Vista Variables in the Via Lactea survey to identify this object.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The photometric properties are consistent to those expected for a dwarf spheroidal galaxy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This work was supported by the Australian Research Council Discovery Project funding scheme under grant DP130104011.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present evidence that ApoBootes may be associated with a previously known overdensity of stars discovered by Belokurov et al. (2007) using SDSS data.

 We study the phenomenological consequences of supersymmetric models with gauge-mediated breaking, in which the Standard Model was extended by adding new vector-like matter fields and extra dimensions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that these models can been constructed such that they are free of any unnatural fine-tuning problems associated with the Higgs mass or flavor-changing neutral currents.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For particular we find that:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The lightest scalar superpartner (the "Higgs" boson) has a mass at most around 300 GeV.  2)

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Flavor changing neutral current effects were suppressed to an acceptable level for generic values of parameters.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 3) Gauge coupling unification occurs naturally despite experimental uncertainties.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 4) There exists a large parameter space where all sparticles have masses above 1 TeV while still satisfying constraints on electroweak symmetry breaking.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These models provide a natural explanation for why there may not yet exist evidence for supersymmetry at accelerator experiments.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present the second part of our study on non-metric gravity theory in which we find that there is no missing mass problem for quasars as claimed by some authors.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also show that this theory can explain the redshifts of quasars without introducing any new parameter or concept into physics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition to these results, we discuss how this theory may get tested experimentally using gravitational waves produced by binary pulsar systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The first part of this work has been published recently [1] .

 I. INTRODUCTORY REMARK In recent years many authors has studied various aspects of nonmetric gravity theories [2] -

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [8] , but none of them seems to having considered the possibility of testing such theories with observations made on distant objects like quasars (QSOs).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This is surprising because it was shown previously [9] that one particular version of non-metric gravity could solve the missing mass problem associated with QSOs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It should therefore not come as a surprise that other versions of non-metric gravity are able to do so too.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The authors have studied the growth rate and its fluctuations for different types of human cancer cells grown under controlled conditions, using an automated image analysis system to measure their size over time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results show that there is considerable variation between individual clones within each type of cell line as well as between different types of cell lines.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This suggests that it may be possible to use this information to classify tumours into subtypes with distinct biological properties.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, they find evidence that the growth rates are correlated across generations of daughter cells, which could provide insight into how these correlations arise during tumorigenesis.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, by comparing the growth characteristics of normal and transformed cells, they conclude that transformation leads to increased heterogeneity among daughter cells.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Cancer is characterized by uncontrolled proliferation of abnormal cells.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Understanding the mechanisms underlying this process could help us develop new treatments against cancer.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, studying the dynamics of cancerous cell populations has been challenging because of difficulties associated with tracking large numbers of single cells simultaneously.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here we report our recent work on characterizing the growth behavior of thousands of individual cancer cells growing in culture dishes [1] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We used an automated imaging system to track the sizes of hundreds of thousands of cells belonging to several different types of human cancer cell lines ( Figure 1 ).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results reveal significant differences in both average growth rates and growth fluctuations between different types of cell lines: some grow faster than others while also exhibiting larger fluctuations around their mean values [2] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We found that the growth rates were highly variable even when measured at the level of individual clones derived from a common parent population

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [3] , suggesting that the observed phenotypic diversity might reflect genetic or epigenetic variations present in the original parental population

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These findings suggest that it should be possible to use such measurements to classify tumors into subtypes based on their growth characteristics [5] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present novel examples of tree-level stable non-BPS D-branes in string theory, which are not associated with spacetime fermion zero modes and thus do not require the presence of orientifolds or other sources for tadpole cancellation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that these brane configurations can be constructed by wrapping unstable D-branes on supersymmetric cycles in Calabi-Yau threefolds.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The resulting BPS states preserve half of the original supersymmetry but carry no net charge under any gauge group factor.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results provide new insights on the structure of moduli spaces of vacua in string theory.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Introduction: In recent years there has been considerable interest in studying non-BPS D-brane (NBD) configurations in type II string theories [1] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 NBDs have attracted attention because they may play an important role in understanding various phenomena such as tachyon condensation

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [2] , open-string pair production

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [3] , and black hole entropy [4] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work we will focus our attention on NBDs whose stability is due to worldsheet instanton effects

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [5] - [7] rather than spacetime fermion zero-modes [9] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Such NBDs are first studied in [10] where it was shown that certain wrapped D3-branes could become stable at one-loop order without requiring the presence of orientifold planes

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Subsequently, several authors [12] - [16] have considered similar constructions involving different types of D-branes and compactifications.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, all of these works required some form of tadpole cancellation [17] so that the total RR-charge carried by the configuration vanishes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Tadpole cancellation conditions place strong constraints on the allowed values of fluxes and charges in the background geometry

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It would therefore be interesting that one could find examples of stable NBDs which did not require the presence of additional sources for tadpole cancellations.
