 We present the results from our analysis of pulsar data obtained with the LOFAR telescope in the Netherlands, which is part of the Low Frequency Array (LOFAR).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The observations are carried out at frequencies between 10 MHz and 120 MHz using the High Band Antenna (HBA) system.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We have detected two new types of pulsars - one that emits bursts of radio waves lasting several seconds and another whose pulses were modulated by an additional signal.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition from these discoveries we also report on the detection of previously unknown phenomena associated with known pulsars.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Pulsars are rapidly rotating neutron stars emitting beams of electromagnetic radiation across the entire visible universe.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They can be observed over many decades as they spin down due to their magnetic dipole field losing energy into space.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This causes them to slow down gradually until they stop completely after about ten billion years.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As well to being extremely stable clocks for measuring time intervals, pulsars provide information about fundamental physics such as gravity, quantum electrodynamics and general relativity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We consider the possibility that our universe was described by a brane world model with an arbitrary number of dimensions, but no reflection symmetry across any of them.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show how to construct such models and discuss their phenomenological consequences for cosmology and particle physics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular we find that there are two classes of solutions which can be distinguished by whether or not they contain closed timelike curves (CTCs).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The first class contains CTCs while the second does not.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In both cases we calculate the effective four dimensional Planck mass as well as the masses of Kaluza-Klein excitations on the brane.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally we study the stability properties for these solutions under small perturbations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This work is supported by NSF grant PHY-0456728.

 PACS numbers: 04.20.-q; 11.25.-w; 98.80.Cq .

 I. INTRODU CTION

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The idea that our universe may have more than three spatial dimensions has been around since the early days of general relativity [1] , when it was realized that Einstein's field equations admit solutions with extra dimensions [2] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In recent years this idea had received renewed interest due to developments in string theory [3] where it appears naturally [4] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 String theoretic constructions typically involve compactification from higher-dimensional space-times down to lower ones [5] - [8] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, even if one starts out with a ten-or eleven-dimensional background solution, the resulting low energy description will generically include additional fields living in the bulk [9] - [11] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These fields couple to matter localized on the branes [12] giving rise to new effects at low energies [13] -

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One particularly interesting feature in many braneworld scenarios [17] - [20] is the presence of time-like singularities [21] - [23] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Such singularities arise whenever the volume with some internal dimension shrinks to zero size [24] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They lead to problems with causality [25] unless the corresponding time coordinate is identified periodically [26] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If this identification is done in a way consistent with supersymmetry then the singularities disappear [27] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Alternatively, one can try to resolve the singularities using quantum gravity [28]

 We report the distance measurement to the Galactic center using Very Long Baseline Array (VLBA) observations at 22 GHz and 43 GHz in combination with Japanese VLBI Exploration of Radio Astrometry (VERA).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The parallax was measured by observing Sgr A*, which is located near the Galactic center, for two years between 2007 and 2009.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We found that the distance to the Galactic center is R0 = 8 kpc ± 0.4 kpc.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This value agrees well to previous measurements based on other methods such as infrared photometry or trigonometric parallaxes of masers associated with massive young stars.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our result also supports the hypothesis that the Milky Way has an axisymmetric mass distribution in its central black hole.

 Keywords: Distance scale, Galaxy, Parallax, Space astrometry, Black holes         1 Introduction

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In order to understand how galaxies evolve over time, it is important to know their distances accurately.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, accurate distances are difficult to measure as they depend strongly on the assumed luminosity evolution model.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, if we assume too high a rate of luminosity evolution, then the derived distance will be underestimated.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 On the other hand, if we assume too low a rate of luminosity evolu-tion, then the derived distance may be overestimated.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Therefore, it is necessary to determine the correct luminosity evolution model before deriving the distance to any galaxy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One way to solve this problem is to use radio sources whose distances can been determined independently through other means.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These include pulsars, quasars, and maser sources associated to star-forming regions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Among these objects, maser sources have been used most frequently since they provide very precise distance estimates.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Maser sources are usually associated with star forming regions where water vapor molecules form into microscopic crystals known as ice grains.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 When the ice grains grow larger than about one micron, they become unstable against gravitational collapse and begin emitting intense radiation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Since the emission line widths of maser sources are extremely narrow compared to those of normal radio

 We study central limit theorems for estimators of parameters in linear regression models where errors is not necessarily normally distributed but have an elliptical distribution, and we allow some explanatory variables to be non-normal.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that under suitable conditions on the model coefficients, the asymptotic distributions of these estimators can become approximated by those obtained when all the explanatory variables follow a multivariate normal distribution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results were illustrated through simulation experiments.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Keywords: Central Limit Theorem; Elliptical Distributions; Regression Modeling.

 For example, this assumption has become used extensively in econometrics (see e.g., Greene [2003] ).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, there are situations where the data generating process does not satisfy such assumptions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This motivates us to consider more general classes for distributions which include as special cases both the normal and nonnormal distributions.

 One class of distributions that includes most common probability density functions encountered in practice is given by the so-called elliptical distributions.

 [1970] , Hüsler and Reiss

 [1981] , and Fang et al.

 = exp{−V (t)}, where V : R → [0, ∞) is called the characteristic generator.

 If V ≡ 0 then X is said to belong to the family of spherical distributions.

 We present an improved version to our previous work on modelling the ultraviolet upturn in early-type galaxies using binary stars.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We use Monte Carlo simulations to generate synthetic populations with different ages, metallicities and mass ratios between components.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The models are compared against observations of nearby galaxies obtained by GALEX.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results show that binary systems can reproduce well both the strength and shape of the observed UV-optical SEDs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular we find that:  - Binary evolution was required to explain the strong UV fluxes seen at young ages (< 1 Gyr).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 - A large fraction of binaries must be composed of two hot subdwarfs or white dwarfs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 - Binaries containing one normal star and one compact object cannot produce enough UV light to match the data.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 - Mass transfer plays only a minor role in shaping the UV-optical SED. -

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The best-fit age distribution peaks around 2 Gyr but extends down to younger ages.

 We report the observation at Landau levels (LLs) of Dirac fermions in single-layered graphite by using scanning tunneling microscopy and spectroscopy at low temperatures.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The LLs were observed as periodic oscillations with magnetic field B, which is perpendicular to the sample surface.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the energy spacing between adjacent LLs decreases with increasing B.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This behavior agrees well to theoretical predictions for massless Dirac fermions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For addition, we observe an unexpected peak structure near zero bias voltage Vbias = 0 mV on top of each LL.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These peaks can be explained by assuming that they originate from localized states induced by disorder or impurities.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results provide direct evidence of the existence of Dirac fermions in graphene-like materials such as graphite.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Graphene has attracted much attention because it exhibits unique electronic properties originating from its two-dimensional honeycomb lattice

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Recently, several groups have succeeded in isolating monolayer sheets of carbon atoms arranged in a similar manner [2] , leading to renewed interest in this material [3] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In contrast to conventional semiconductors, where electrons behave like massive particles, the charge carriers in graphene obey relativistic quantum mechanics [4] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In a result, their dynamics exhibit many unusual features including Klein tunnelling [5] , Zitterbewegung

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [6] , the half-integer quantum Hall effect

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Moreover, the low-energy excitations in graphene were described by massless Dirac fermions [9] whose dispersion relation E(k) shows linear dependence around two inequivalent points K and K' in momentum space

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Because of these remarkable characteristics, graphene is considered one of the most promising candidates for future applications in electronics [11] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Recently, there has been growing interest in other layered materials having a similar atomic arrangement

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Among them, graphite is particularly interesting as it consists of stacked layers of graphene

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 While the interlayer coupling leads to a gap opening [14] , the band structure still retains some resemblance to that of graphene

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As example, the Fermi velocity vF ~ 10 6 m/s [16] is almost identical to that of graphene [17] .

 We present far-infrared (FIR) images of two nearby spiral galaxies, NGC 2841 and NGC 2976, obtained by the Far Infrared Surveyor (FIS) onboard Akari satellite.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The FIS has four photometric bands of 65, 90, 140, and 160 μm.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We have detected FIR emission from both galaxies out to their optical radii.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The total infrared luminosities are estimated as 1.1×10^11 L_sun for NGC 2841 and 2.3×10^10 L_sun for NGC 2976 using the flux densities measured within the apertures corresponding to the optical radii.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These values agree well to those derived from previous observations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The radial profiles show that the FIR surface brightnesses decrease exponentially toward outer regions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The dust temperatures are found to be about 30 K near the centers but increase outward up to 60-70K beyond the optical radii.

 We report on the discovery of new, bright X-ray emission from the central region of the galaxy cluster Abell 2597 (z = 0.0176).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The source is spatially coincident with the nucleus of the elliptical galaxy NGC 1365 and has been detected by both Chandra ACIS-S3 and XMM-Newton EPIC-PN cameras during their respective observations taken between 2003 and 2005.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that this newly discovered activity can be described as a series of short-lived bursts lasting for about 100 s each.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These events were separated by longer periods of quiescence which last up to several hours.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In these active phases we measure a luminosity of Lx ~ 1043 erg/s at 2-10 keV.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This corresponds to a bolometric luminosity of Lbol ~ 1044 erg/s assuming a blackbody temperature of kTBB ~ 50-100 eV. Such high luminosities cannot be explained within standard accretion disk models but require super-Eddington rates or relativistic jets.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Spin echoes are observed when the spin system is subjected to two successive radio-frequency (RF) pulses separated by an interval, known as the pulse separation time Tsep.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The first RF pulse creates a macroscopic magnetization vector M0 that precesses with the external magnetic field Bext at Larmor frequency fL = γBext where γ is gyromagnetic ratio for nuclear spins.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 After the second RF pulse with flip angle θ2 and phase shift φ2 relative to the first one, the transverse component of the magnetization vector M2(t) decays exponentially due to dephasing caused by local magnetic fields created by neighboring nuclei.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work we show how strong π-pulses can be used to generate spin echoes even if there is no net initial magnetization present before applying these pulses.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We demonstrate theoretically and experimentally that such spin echoes originate intrinsically from the dipolar interactions between nuclear spins.

 The subgrid-scale stress tensor is an important quantity in large-eddy simulation (LES) that describes the effect of unresolved turbulent motions on resolved scales.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work, we present new closures based on matrix exponential functions to model the anisotropic part of the subgrid-scale stress tensor and its associated transport coefficients.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The proposed closure models were derived by assuming statistical homogeneity and isotropy at small length scales within each computational cell.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that these closures can be expressed as simple algebraic expressions involving only second-order statistics of the resolved velocity field.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These closures were tested against direct numerical simulations of homogeneous shear flows with different Reynolds numbers ranging between Re = 100 and 1000.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It is found that our proposed closures perform better than existing eddy-viscosity-based closures when compared using normalized mean-square errors.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, it should be noted that the proposed closures have been implemented into the open-source LES code Nektar++.

 We present an analysis of the temperature dependence of Yb3+ doped materials for high power laser applications, with particular emphasis to Yb:YAG and Yb:SYS.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results are obtained by means of numerical simulations based on rate equations that take into account all relevant energy transfer processes between ions as well as non-radiative relaxation mechanisms.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show how these parameters affect the performance in the active medium at different temperatures.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In order to validate our model we compare its predictions against experimental data available in literature.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we discuss possible strategies aimed at improving the efficiency of Yb-doped materials under operating conditions close to room temperature.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Lasers has become one of the most important tools in modern science and technology due to their unique properties such as monochromaticity, directionality and coherence [1] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Amongst them, solid-state lasers (SSLs) represent a very promising class of devices thanks to their compactness, reliability and low cost [2] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In recent years SSLs have become widely used in many fields including medicine

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [3] , telecommunications [4] , metrology [5] , remote sensing [6] , spectroscopy [7] , optical pumping [8] , etc.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, besides their advantages over other types of lasers, they suffer from several drawbacks related mainly to heat generation

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Indeed, when working at high powers or repetition rates, SSLs may easily reach temperatures higher than 100 °C

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [10] which can cause severe damage to the gain media

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This is particularly true for Yb-doped materials [12] since Yb3+ has a relatively large Stokes shift

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [13] leading to poor overlap between absorption and emission bands [14] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In a result, Yb-doped materials exhibit lower quantum efficiencies compared to Nd-doped ones [15] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Moreover, Yb3+ ions tend to aggregate [16] causing additional losses [17] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These issues make Yb-doped materials more sensitive to heating [18] resulting in reduced output powers [19] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Therefore, it becomes crucial to understand the physical phenomena involved in the operation of Yb-doped materials [20] so as to improve their performances [21] .

 We present new spectroscopic observations on nine cataclysmic variable stars (CVs) obtained with the HIRES spectrograph on Keck I telescope in Hawaii, and compare them to previous results.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that all CVs show double-peaked emission lines which are characteristic features of accretion disks around white dwarfs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The line profiles change dramatically during outburst phases when mass transfer rates increase by several orders of magnitude compared to quiescent states.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition we detect absorption components at red-shifted velocities in some systems indicating the presence of an extended disk wind or stream overflowing into the disk.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results provide important constraints for theoretical models of CV evolution.

 Keywords: Accretion Disk, Double-Peaked Emission Lines, White Dwarf, Cataclysmic Variables         1 Introduction     Cataclysmic variables (CVs), also known as dwarf novae, are close binary systems consisting of a white dwarf primary star and a late-type secondary star filling its Roche lobe.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Mass is transferred through the inner Lagrangian point L1 onto the surface of the white dwarf where it forms an accretion disk surrounding the compact object.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This process leads to periodic outbursts caused by thermal instabilities in the accretion disk resulting in dramatic changes in luminosity over time scales ranging from hours up to years

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 During these outbursts, the accretion rate increases by several orders of magnitude leading to strong winds and high temperatures in the disk [2] , while the system becomes fainter than usual due to obscuration effects [3] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The study of CVs provides valuable information about the physical processes involved in accretion flows [4] , magnetic fields

 [5] , and angular momentum transport

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Furthermore, they can be used as distance indicators

 [7, 8] and probes of galactic structure

 [10] mounted at at 10 m

 I telescope located on Mauna Kea

 In this work, we consider the problem of downlink transmission in multi-user MIMO systems where each user is equipped with multiple antennas and the base station has imperfect channel state information (CSI).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We propose bit-interleaved coded beamforming schemes in both single-user and multiuser scenarios to improve system performance under imperfect CSI at the transmitter side.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, we first develop an optimal linear precoding scheme based on minimum mean square error criterion by exploiting the statistical properties of the estimated channels.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Then, we present two practical coding schemes that can been implemented efficiently using low-density parity-check codes or polar codes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, numerical results are provided to demonstrate the effectiveness of our proposed schemes over existing ones.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The main contributions to this thesis include:  1)

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Optimal Linear Precoding Scheme: We derive closed-form expressions for the ergodic capacity achieved by the optimal linear precoder when the number of transmit antennas goes to infinity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 2) Practical Code Designs: We design practical coding schemes which can been implemented efficiently using LDPC codes or polar codes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 3) Numerical Results: We provide simulation results to show the advantages in our proposed schemes compared to existing ones.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In recent years there has been growing interest in developing efficient solutions to problems related to computational complexity theory such as the Graph Isomorphism Problem(GIP).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This problem consists of determining whether two given graphs are isomorphic or not; i.e., if they have the same structure regardless of their labels.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Classical approaches to solve GIP usually rely upon Random Walks techniques combined with some heuristics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However these methods require exponential time for the worst case scenario.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In the other hand, Quantum Algorithms provide polynomial-time solutions to many NP-complete problems including GIP.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The algorithms exploit the superposition principle which allows them to explore all possible states simultaneously.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, Shor's Algorithm solves integer factorization in polynomial time while Grover's Search finds any item within a database in quadratic time.

 The Coulomb drag effect is the phenomenon where one charge carrier may transfer energy to another by exchanging virtual phonons, leading to an electric current in the second carrier that opposes its own motion.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work we study the Coulomb drag between two graphene sheets separated by a dielectric spacer layer and subject to different gate voltages.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 Transient enhanced diffusion (TED), i.e., the redistribution of dopants after high energy implantation followed by rapid thermal annealing (RTA), has become studied extensively over the past two decades [1] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results suggest that the current models do not fully capture the physics underlying TED.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 The low energy effective theories for superstrings are supergravity and supersymmetric gauge theories in four dimensions, which can be obtained by compactifying the extra six spatial dimensions on a Calabi-Yau manifold.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The basic idea is to use Monte Carlo simulations to study supersymmetric field theories defined on a finite number of points (the sites) of a regular d-dimensional hypercubic lattice with periodic boundary conditions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These models have become studied extensively over the past few years using numerical techniques such as exact diagonalization, quantum Monte Carlo methods, and density matrix renormalization group algorithms.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Recently we developed new Monte Carlo simulation techniques based on the worm algorithm that allow us to simulate large systems at very high temperatures where conventional Monte Carlo methods fail because they suffer from critical slowing down.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We used our new method to calculate the free energies for several different supersymmetric lattice models including the N = 4 supersymmetric Yang-Mills theory and the N = 1 supersymmetric U(1) gauge theory coupled to matter fields with various representations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that this method can also be used in high-Reynolds number situations where it produces accurate results even though its underlying assumptions are not valid anymore.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The main advantage over standard LES methods lies in the fact that no explicit subgrid-scale models have to been introduced.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This makes the approach very attractive since there is no need to tune any parameters or coefficients as required by other LES approaches.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition we demonstrate how the LANS-alpha method can been combined with an implicit LES scheme based on the variational multiscale formulation (VMS-LES) to obtain more efficient computations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we discuss some open issues related with the use of these schemes in practical applications.

 Turbulence plays a crucial role for many physical phenomena ranging from weather prediction to oceanic circulation and combustion processes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, despite decades of research turbulence still remains one of the most challenging problems in computational fluid dynamics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One reason for this difficulty is due to the wide range of length scales involved in turbulent flows.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Since large eddies contain most of the kinetic energy they only occupy a small fraction of the total volume.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 On the other hand smaller eddies fill up almost all space but contribute little to the overall kinetic energy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Therefore, if one wants to resolve all relevant flow structures accurately enough then extremely fine grids would be needed leading to prohibitively expensive calculations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 To overcome this problem so-called Large Eddy Simulations (LESs) are developed during the last two decades [1, 2] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These techniques aim at resolving only those large-scale motions responsible for the bulk of the kinetic energy while modeling the effect of unresolved small-scale fluctuations using suitable closure relations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Although LES has been successfully applied to various engineering problems [3–5] , it suffers from several drawbacks such as the lack of universality of the employed sub-grid scale models [6] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In recent years new classes of LES-like methods have emerged [7–10] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The luminosity ratio between these two thermal components is L h /L

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition to this multi-component continuum model, we also include several emission lines such as Fe Kα line and OVII triplet.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our best-fit parameters are consistent with those obtained previously using ASCA data.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Using the Chandra HETG observation taken during 2001-2002, we have investigated the short-term variability behavior of CIV 1549.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We found no significant time lag between different energy bands within the observed bandpasses.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, there appears to exist some correlation between flux variations in hard energies (> 4 keV) and those in softer energies (< 4 keV), although it does not appear to be strictly linear relationship.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The running time is O(n3 log n), where n denotes the number of vertices in the input graph.

 For example, if we want to compute the distance between two cities using road maps, we may not allow a city to get used as a starting point again after visiting another city.

 Introduction  The Catalan numbers count many combinatorial objects such as binary trees, noncrossing partitions, spanning trees, etc., see e.g.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The present work deals in another class of Catalan-like objects: triangulations of polygons (see Figure 1 ).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A triangulation T of a simple polygon P is defined as follows: it consists of all edges of P together with some additional diagonals connecting pairs of vertices of P so that each interior angle of P becomes at least 90 degrees after adding these diagonals.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It follows immediately because every edge belongs to one and only one diagonal of T .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In [3] , Motzkin and Straus' celebrated theorem states that if D denotes the set of diagonals of a convex polygon Q then |D| = 2|Q|.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They also proved that the number of diagonalizations d(P ) of a convex polygon P equals the number of diagonals of a triangulation of P .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It was shown recently [4] that the number of diagonals in a triangulation of a convex quadrilateral is equal to four times the number of diagonals needed to diagonalize the quadrilateral.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Thus, the following question arises naturally: What is the relationship between the number of diagonals required to diagonalize a convex quadrilateral and the number of diagonals used in a triangulation?

 The origin and evolution of cosmic magnetic fields are one of the most important unsolved problems in astrophysics, which is closely related to many other fundamental issues such as star formation, galaxy formation and structure formation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this talk I will review our recent work on simulating primordial magnetic fields with different physical processes involved.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The first part focuses on the generation of seed magnetic fields during inflation by quantum fluctuations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that these seeds can be amplified significantly after reheating due to the magnetohydrodynamic turbulence driven by the decaying inflaton perturbations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Then we discuss how these seeds evolve into large-scale coherent magnetic fields through various mechanisms including inverse cascade, dynamo action and turbulent pumping.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we present some possible observational signatures to future detection.

 We study the ground-state properties of two-flavor color superconducting (2SC) quark matter at finite density and temperature by using an effective chiral model with vector interaction, which is derived from QCD under the mean-field approximation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 We study the efficiency of cosmic ray (CR) acceleration by relativistic shocks using Monte Carlo simulations and analytical calculations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that, for strong shocks with Mach number M = 10 - 100, only about 1% CRs can be accelerated to ultra-high energy (UHE).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This is because most particles are scattered back upstream before they gain enough energy to cross the shock front again.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The low efficiency of UHE particle production leads to an upper limit on the maximum proton energy as well as the total CR luminosity produced by such shocks.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results suggest that the observed fluxes of UHE protons cannot be explained solely by diffusive shock acceleration mechanism operating at cosmological shocks.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, our findings do not rule out other mechanisms proposed recently to explain the origin of UHE cosmic rays.
